cyclone.name: DELTA
cyclone.current_location: about 75 miles south of Kingston, Jamaica
cyclone.trajectory: accelerating northwest across the north-western Caribbean, crossing western Cuba Tuesday, then moving through the central Gulf of Mexico toward the north-central Gulf Coast late week

weather_observation.watch_coast: Hurricane Watch for Isle of Youth and the Cuban provinces of Pinar del Rio and Artemisa; Tropical Storm Watch for La Habana
weather_observation.warning_coast: Tropical Storm Warning for the Cayman Islands
weather_observation.impacted_coast: North-western Caribbean, western Cuba, then the northern Gulf Coast from the TX-LA border eastward to the FL Panhandle late week
weather_observation.rain_fall_above_4_inch: Unlikely but possible if the core shifts west (>25% chance)
weather_observation.wind: Low chance (≤12%) of tropical-storm force winds; breezy conditions with gusts 25–35 kt possible late Thursday into Friday
weather_observation.storm_surge: Minor surge 1–3 ft possible along the upper Texas coast if the storm tracks closer to Beaumont
weather_observation.rainfall: Outer rainbands could bring 1–3 inches of rain, locally higher if the track shifts west
weather_observation.other_hazards: Building seas and long-period swell could hamper barge and pilot operations in the Sabine/Neches channels late week
